document_data.name: Andram Rendarth
document_data.mainbody: '''Andram Rendarth''' was a [[War Wizard]] of [[Cormyr]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Abilities: He knew how to consume wards to bolster magic.
document_data.Activities: He was a [[War Wizard of Cormyr]].
document_data.History:
On orders from [[Ganrahast Aeiulvana]] to slay Elminster and retrieve a part that could be used to identify the body, Andram Rendarth was part of an ambush set for [[Elminster Aumar]], a fugitive [[wizard]], in {{yearlink|1479}}, when the latter snuck into [[Castle Obarskyr]] in [[Suzail]] again, after stealing the ''[[Royal Gorget of Battle]]'' earlier in the year. During that ambush, Andram Rendarth used a deadly spell, bolstered by consuming and unweaving wards in the castle, against Elminster and his companion, [[Storm Silverhand]]. That was extremely painful, but did not kill them. He later sent one of his underlings, [[Rorskryn Mreldrake]], who had already faced Elminster earlier during the raid at [[Tethgard]], to check if the man remained in one piece. Elminster quickly countered with an [[enchanted]] [[wand of paralysis]], which froze two war wizards, missing Rorskryn; Elminster voiced his extreme displeasure that Andram Rendarth had unwound the wards, and the fact that Ganrahast had obviously signed off on that.

A watching [[Manshoon]] shared Elminster's displeasure, and decided Rendarth had to be slain, to give Ganrahast the message that the wards were to be left alone.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|123|12}}
